alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, southeastern Lexington, north central Orangeburg and south central Richland Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sandy Run, or 12 miles south of Cayce, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gaston, Congaree National Park, Sandy Run, Swansea, Woodford, New Zion and Lexington Acres Pond. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 120 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland
